demographics.name: Carson Johnson
demographics.supportServices: Referral to brain tumor support group.

diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Maximal safe surgical resection (05/08/2025) by Dr. David Chang (Neurosurgery)

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) - Craniospinal Irradiation (CSI) with involved field boost.
treatmentPlan.rtRxDetails: 23.4 Gy in 13 fractions to Craniospinal Axis, followed by 30.6 Gy in 17 fractions boost to Posterior Fossa (Total 54 Gy to Posterior Fossa)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: Whole brain and spine (to bottom of thecal sac) for CSI; Posterior Fossa for boost.
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: 3D-CRT with gapped abutting fields for craniospinal axis, followed by 3D-CRT for posterior fossa boost. Proton therapy considered but not available.
treatmentPlan.concurrentChemo: None (Vincristine omitted per NCCN guidelines for adults)
medications: Dexamethasone 2 mg PO BID (Tapering schedule planned)
therapistAlerts: Monitor for signs of fatigue and myelosuppression.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Prone, head neutral in custom Aquaplast mask indexed to table, arms abducted above head for craniospinal setup. Patient aligned to room lasers using anterior and bilateral marks.
ctSimulation.immobilization: Custom Aquaplast thermoplastic mask, prone belly board, knee/ankle immobilization.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Tattoos placed per protocol. Isocenter for CSI set at...
ctSimulation.ctNotes: Contrast-enhanced CT acquired in treatment position for CSI and boost planning.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Emily Roberts
dosimetry.rx: CSI: 23.4 Gy / 13 fx; PFB Boost: 30.6 Gy / 17 fx (Total 54 Gy)
dosimetry.technique: 3D-CRT (CSI with abutted fields, PFB boost with 3D fields)
dosimetry.numberOfFieldsOrArcs: Multiple fields for CSI; multiple fields for boost
dosimetry.gantryAngles: Field arrangements for craniospinal and posterior fossa fields per protocol.
dosimetry.isoCoords: CSI: setup dependent; PFB: specific to target.
dosimetry.constraints: Lens Max < 10 Gy; Optic Nerves Max < 35 Gy; Brainstem Max < 54 Gy; Spinal Cord Max < 45 Gy. All constraints met.
dosimetry.planNotes: Standard risk medulloblastoma, WNT-activated. CSI to 23.4 Gy with involved field boost to posterior fossa to 54 Gy. Vincristine omitted for adult patient. Gapped abutting fields for craniospinal axis to prevent overlap and underdosing.

igrtProtocol.type: kV Imaging (Orthogonal Pair) for CSI; CBCT for PFB boost
igrtProtocol.alignment: CSI: Bony anatomy of the skull and spine; PFB: Bony anatomy of the skull with soft tissue where appropriate.

imagingAndReports.summary: Medulloblastoma, Classic Histology, WNT-activated (CTNNB1 mutation positive).

reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Sections show a densely cellular embryonal neoplasm composed of small, round blue cells. Features include scant cytoplasm, hyperchromatic nuclei, and high mitotic activity. Rosettes are present.
reportDetails.molecularInformation: CTNNB1 mutation: Positive (WNT-activated subtype). Monosomy 6: Present.
reportDetails.comment: The histologic and molecular features are diagnostic of WNT-activated medulloblastoma, WHO Grade 4. This subtype is associated with a favorable prognosis.

imagingAndReports.summary: No gross residual disease identified in the posterior fossa. No evidence of leptomeningeal spread.

reportDetails.findings: Post-surgical changes in the cerebellum consistent with resection. No enhancing residual tumor. Ventricular system stable. No hydrocephalus. CSF spaces appear clear.
reportDetails.impression: Post-operative MRI, no gross residual disease of cerebellar medulloblastoma.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Emily Roberts (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt seen post-op for cerebellar Medulloblastoma. Reviewed imaging, pathology (WNT-activated, good prognosis). Discussed standard of care adjuvant craniospinal irradiation (CSI) with posterior fossa boost. Explained goals (reduce recurrence risk), procedure, potential side effects (fatigue, myelosuppression, hair loss). Pt understands and agrees. Plan for CT Sim with prone setup for CSI.

progressNotes.author: Sarah Jones, RTT
progressNotes.summary: CT Sim completed for adjuvant CSI + PFB boost. Aquaplast mask, belly board, knee/ankle immobilization fabricated. Patient immobilized prone. Tolerated well. Data sent for 3D-CRT planning with gapped abutting fields.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Emily Roberts (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient completed 5/13 fractions of CSI. Tolerating reasonably well. Mild fatigue reported. Scalp care reviewed. CBC today noted, acceptable to continue. Continue current plan. Will transition to PFB boost after CSI completion.

progressNotes.author: Mark Evans, RTT
progressNotes.summary: Completed 13/13 fractions of CSI today. Patient tolerated the full course well with expected fatigue. Next week will begin the posterior fossa boost. Explained field changes and daily CBCT imaging.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant therapy to prevent recurrence after surgery and address microscopic disease spread along the central nervous system.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue, hair loss (scalp and spinal field), skin redness, lowered blood counts (myelosuppression), potential long-term neurocognitive effects.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of proper positioning for daily treatment, skin care along radiation fields, monitoring for signs of infection (due to low blood counts), reporting any new neurological symptoms.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, maintain good nutrition and hydration, attend weekly OTVs and lab draws.
